title: Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet weighs in on Lucas Giolito’s ongoing free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Lucas Giolito, after opting out of his Red Sox contract, remains unsigned in 2026 free agency.
Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet expressed surprise at Giolito's free agency status despite his strong 2025 performance.
Red Sox added Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez to their rotation, reducing chances of Giolito's return to Boston.

title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Michael Pittman Jr. of the Colts and DJ Moore from the Bears are potential trade targets for the Patriots.
Offensive lineman Walker Little from the Jaguars and Seahawks edge rusher Uchenna Nwosu could be Patriots trade options.
Jaguars wide receiver Brian Thomas Jr., known for his big-play potential, is another potential target for the Patriots.

title: Jayson Tatum says he still doesn’t have a return date after participating in a 5-on-5 scrimmage at Celtics practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a five-on-five scrimmage with the Boston Celtics but has not set a return date.
Tatum's ongoing rehab from an Achilles tear includes practices with the G League's Maine Celtics and team workouts.
Speculation grows about Tatum's return, with NBA games flexed and a documentary trailer highlighting his recovery journey.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: NBC Sports' Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko praised for their coverage of Team USA's women's hockey gold medal win.
Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir adopted a minimalist approach during Alysa Liu's gold-medal-winning figure skating performance.
Providence topped national viewership ratings for the Super Bowl, with Boston ranked third and Seattle fifth.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Three free MBTA bus routes, 23, 28, and 29, extended through June using leftover federal funds.
The routes serve Boston areas Mattapan, Dorchester, and Roxbury; future funding is still under discussion.
Mayor Wu seeks long-term funding solutions, discussing potential plans with Governor Maura Healey's administration.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County reported the highest snowfall totals with up to 6.5 inches in Leyden as of February 21.
Essex County saw significant snowfall, including 5 inches in Haverhill, with other towns receiving 3 to 4 inches.
A larger storm with possible blizzard conditions and power outages is predicted for Sunday night into Monday.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa, 30, from Canton, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon in honor of the 2013 bombing victims.
LaRosa cites her admiration for past runners and inspiration from a coworker as motivation for her participation.
The 2026 event marks a personal achievement for LaRosa, as she reflects on the marathon's impact on her life.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac, 38, of Pembroke, NH, sentenced to 15 months for fraudulently using COVID relief funds to buy a golf course.
Kirouac secured over $1M in Economic Injury Disaster Loans, misusing $600,000 for purchasing Angus Lea Golf Course.
Authorities stated Kirouac failed to disclose company sales while obtaining EIDLs, violating CARES Act regulations.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, charged with four counts of larceny over $1,200 in Boston high-end store thefts.
Cutelis, with a 25-year theft record, also faces drug possession charges; bail set at $2,500.
Incidents involved thefts at Lululemon and Ralph Lauren stores, totaling goods worth over $10,000.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony will continue as the Red Sox' leadoff hitter for the 2026 season, according to manager Alex Cora.
Anthony's .396 on-base percentage in 2025 would have ranked third in the majors if he had enough at-bats.
Red Sox lineup may feature Willson Contreras hitting cleanup and a potential lefty-righty balance with Trevor Story batting second.
